file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-28-62-04 - CONFIG-2 - CABINET BASEPLATE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CABINET BASEPLATE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH MEDEVAC CONFIGURATION 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the cabinet baseplate. B. The cabinet baseplate is installed in zone 242. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH ME- DEVAC CONFIGURA- 25-28-62-000-801-A CABINET BASEPLATE - REMOVAL TION AIRCRAFT WITH ME- DEVAC CONFIGURA- 25-28-62-400-801-A CABINET BASEPLATE - INSTALLATION TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 25-28-62 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-28-62-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH MEDEVAC CONFIGURATION 2. CABINET BASEPLATE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to remove the cabinet baseplate. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 242 Passenger cabin C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Remove the cabinet baseplate as follows: NOTE: Before the removal, identify the location of each cabinet baseplate to make sure that it is installed back in the same position as that from which it was removed. (a) Remove the track lining sections (9) as applicable. (b) Loosen the bolts (4), lock washers (3), washers (2), inner bushings (5), outer bushings (6), and galley fittings (7) that attach the cabinet baseplate (1) to the lateral track (8). (c) Loosen the lock washers (17), washers (16), inner bushings (15), outer bushings (14), washers (13), retainers (12), and the studs (11) that attach the cabinet baseplate (1) to the floor track (10). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-28-62 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (d) Move the cabinet baseplate (1) horizontally to a position where the tracks align with the larger openings of the track slot. (e) Pull up the cabinet baseplate (1) to remove it. (f) Remove the galley fittings (7) from the lateral track (8). (g) Remove the retainers (12) and stud (11) from the floor track (10). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-28-62 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH MEDEVAC CONFIGURATION Cabinet Baseplate - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONE 242 L1 L2 DET. A 5. INNER BUSHING 6. OUTER BUSHING L1 = 944.0 (37.17) 4. BOLT L2 = 1041.4 (41) 3. LOCK WASHER NOTE: 7. GALLEY DIMENSIONS ARE IN MILLIMETERS WITH FITTINGS INCH CONVERSIONS IN PARENTHESES. 2. WASHER 1. CABINET 8. LATERAL BASEPLATE TRACK 17. LOCK WASHER 16. WASHER 15. INNER BUSHING 14. OUTER BUSHING 13. WASHER 12. RETAINER 11. STUD DATUM LINE FOR PITCH 10. FLOOR TRACK MEASUREMENT 9. TRACK LINNING STARTING POINT SECTION OF CABINET BASEPLATE INSTALLATION DET. B (TYPICAL) EM145AMM253112A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-28-62 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-28-62-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH MEDEVAC CONFIGURATION 3. CABINET BASEPLATE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to install the cabinet baseplate. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-28-04-200-801-A/600 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 242 Passenger cabin D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Install the cabinet baseplate as follows: NOTE: • Make sure that the cabinet baseplate is back to the same location as that from which it was removed. • Start the installation of the cabinet baseplate from the first larger opening of the track slot and from the rear portion to the front portion. Refer to DET. B. • Obey the pitch of 1041.4 millimeters (41 inches) between the rows. • The pitch between the cabinet baseplates is measured from the front leg of one cabinet baseplate to the front leg of the subsequent cabinet baseplate. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-28-62 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • The distance between the first cabinet baseplate and the windscreen is measured from the front leg of the cabinet baseplate to the windscreen. (a) Install the galley fittings (7) at the lateral track (8). (b) Install the retainers (12) and stud (11) at the floor track (10). (c) Put the cabinet baseplate (1) in a position where the fittings align with the larger openings of the track slot. (d) Push the cabinet baseplate (1) down and move it horizontally until it is in the correct position. (e) Make sure that the cabinet baseplate (1) is in the correct position and attach the galley fittings (7), outer bushings (6), inner bushings (5), washers (2), lock washers (3), and bolts (4) to the lateral track (8). (f) Attach the studs (11), retainers (12), washers (13), outer bushings (14), inner bushings (15), washers (16), and lock washers (17) that attach the cabinet baseplate (1) to the floor track (10). (g) Install the track lining sections (9) as applicable. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Do the visual check at the baseplates AMM TASK 25-28-04-200-801-A/600. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-28-62 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
